abstracts.cdata!:
The Project ratings convey satisfactory
            project outcomes, likely sustainability, with only modest
            institutional development impacts. Lessons are addressed as
            follows. The model established by the Family Assistance
            Program (PRAF) under the project, aims at protecting the
            most vulnerable groups, from potentially, negative impacts
            of economic structural adjustment, and from the effects of
            absolute poverty. It provides financial incentives to poor
            families, including significant impact on improving the
            nutrition, health and education conditions of the family. As
            such, experience shows that demand-side interventions need
            to be accompanied by provision of effective social
            protection, to ensure coverage for demand incentives. In
            addition, the appropriately structured community
            participation, contributed to sustainability, based on four
            key successful elements in water and sanitation: training
            and community participation; community involvement in the
            provision of spare parts and supplies; use of appropriate
            technology; and, nomination of promoters within the
            councils, able to ensure information dissemination on health
            matters, and motivated to sustain the system. However, links
            between nutrition and education should be reinforced;
            strategic attention to infrastructure activities could
            further improve outcomes; and, improved communications could
            reduce delays, particularly as experienced during
            implementation regarding disbursement requests, and
            replenishment of the Special Account.

18152950.subsc: Sanitation,Other social services,Health,Pre-primary education,Central government administration
18152950.theme: Pollution management and environmental health,Nutrition and food security,Health system performance,Social safety nets
18152950.trustfund: TF025330-PHRD-SOCIAL SECTOR RESTRUCTURING,TF029595-PHRD-HEALTH SECTOR REFORM PROJECT
18152950.majtheme: Environment and natural resource management,Human development,Social protection and risk management

abstracts.cdata!:
The project will provide for: (1)
            expanding nutrition assistance and developing a longer-term
            nutrition policy by expanding the food coupon programs to
            the poor, pregnant and nursing women, children under five,
            and primary school children, and to give nutrition education
            for health staff, community workers and mothers focusing on
            breast-feeding, weaning and early childhood feeding
            practices; (2) strengthening the delivery of basic health
            services which includes rehabilitation of about 130 health
            care centers and construction of an estimated 30 additional
            health centers in priority rural areas, provide basic drugs
            for the primary health care network, support the formulation
            and implementation of a medium-term national AIDS control
            program; (3) improving environmental health through the
            provision of rural water supply and sanitation supported by
            community participation, and a medical waste disposal
            training program; and (4) monitoring, evaluating and
            auditing which will include institutional strengthening of
            the Social Cabinet Executive Secretariat.
